text: Styles are applied on a string of characters.
_Note:_ Combinations of styles will be eventually supported. At the moment, combining them may cause bizarre results.

Currently, superscripts & subscripts are only supported in the HTML format. There don't seem to be any Markdown conventions for this particular styling. There may be a way to handle certain, special case HTML styles, tags within the Markdown format, as shown below. For the moment, however, this is not yet implemented
const msg = "I can write FORTRAN in any language!";
### 6. _Numbered Lists_ (nesting numbered lists not yet working)
1. Two can be as bad as one;
1. it's the loneliest number, since the number one.
Paragraphs are simply long lines of text in this JSON file. To be formatted as a paragraph they must be all on the same line.
Successive long text strings create separate paragraphs. Of course, it would be possible to tweak the rendering of all this. But, for the moment, this is all that is implemented.
The following paragraph is prefixed with a `> ` mark that will cause it to render as a block quote.

> I know not how I seem to others, but to myself I am but a small child wandering upon the vast shores of knowledge, every now and then finding a small bright pebble to content myself with while the vast ocean of undiscovered truth lay before me.
Links and images are a bit more difficult than can be done in the time remaining. These will need to be finished, or disabled.
In addition to the Markdown format, HTML is also supported. This is a sampling of HTML styled text.
<h2>Some HTML style examples (this is an h2):
• A ham sandwich is better than nothing.
• Ergo, A ham sandwich is better than complete happiness.
